verses.translation: By the dawn
And [by] ten nights
And [by] the even [number] and the odd
And [by] the night when it passes,

verses.arabic: هَلۡ فِی ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ قَسَمࣱ لِّذِی حِجۡرٍ
verses.translation: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
verses.transliteration: Hal fee zaalika qasamul lizee hijr

verses.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَیۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
verses.translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -
verses.transliteration: Alam tara kaifa fa'ala rabbuka bi'aad

verses.translation: [With] Iram - who had lofty pillars,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّتِی لَمۡ یُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِی ٱلۡبِلَـٰدِ
verses.translation: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
verses.transliteration: Allatee lam yukhlaq misluhaa fil bilaad

verses.translation: And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
verses.transliteration: Wa samoodal lazeena jaabus sakhra bil waad

verses.translation: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -
[All of] whom oppressed within the lands
And increased therein the corruption.
So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَكۡرَمَنِ
verses.translation: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."
verses.transliteration: Fa ammal insaanu izaa mab talaahu Rabbuhoo fa akramahoo wa na' 'amahoo fa yaqoolu Rabbeee akraman

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّاۤ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَیۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَیَقُولُ رَبِّیۤ أَهَـٰنَنِ
verses.translation: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
verses.transliteration: Wa ammaaa izaa mabtalaahu faqadara 'alaihi rizqahoo fa yaqoolu Rabbeee ahaanan

verses.translation: No! But you do not honor the orphan
verses.transliteration: Kalla bal laa tukrimooo nal yateem

verses.translation: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
And you love wealth with immense love.

verses.arabic: كَلَّاۤۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكࣰّا دَكࣰّا
verses.translation: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed -
verses.transliteration: Kallaaa izaaa dukkatil ardu dakkan dakka

verses.translation: And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,
verses.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a Rabbuka wal malaku saffan saffaa

verses.arabic: وَجِا۟یۤءَ یَوۡمَىِٕذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ یَوۡمَىِٕذࣲ یَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
verses.translation: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but what good to him will be the remembrance?
verses.transliteration: Wa jeee'a yawma'izim bi jahannnam; Yawma 'iziny yatazakkarul insaanu wa annaa lahuz zikraa

verses.translation: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."
So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
verses.transliteration: Fa Yawma izil laa yu'azzibu 'azaabahooo ahad

verses.translation: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
verses.transliteration: Wa laa yoosiqu wasaaqa hooo ahad

verses.translation: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants
And enter My Paradise."
